summary: Successfully tested governance V2 API create record bug fix. All 5 module types (minutes, distribution, dispute, insurance, compensation) can now create records with frontend field names. Payload models correctly accept alternative field names like 'date_time', 'death_benefit', 'carrier_name', 'recipient_name', 'scheduled_date' and preserve all fields with 'extra = allow' configuration. Frontend authentication protection working correctly.
passed_tests: POST /api/governance/v2/records creates meeting minutes successfully with frontend field names (date_time, meeting_datetime)
POST /api/governance/v2/records creates distribution successfully with frontend field names (scheduled_date, recipients)
POST /api/governance/v2/records creates dispute successfully with frontend field names (parties, events)
POST /api/governance/v2/records creates insurance policy successfully with frontend field names (carrier_name, death_benefit, premium_amount)
POST /api/governance/v2/records creates compensation entry successfully with frontend field names (recipient_name, recipient_role)
Created records appear in GET /api/governance/v2/records filtered lists for all module types
Created records can be retrieved individually via GET /api/governance/v2/records/{id}
All payload fields are preserved in created records including alternative field names
Payload models accept extra fields with 'extra = allow' configuration
Frontend loads correctly and shows proper authentication protection
Protected governance routes redirect to login page as expected
Google OAuth integration displays correctly on login page

success_percentage.backend: 100% - All V2 governance record creation endpoints working with frontend field names
success_percentage.frontend: 100% - Authentication protection working correctly, login page displays properly
